title: Microlearning Course for Enhancing Physics Laboratory Skills via Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory college-level physics theory and experimental tool usage experience
context.additional_context: Primarily targeting first-year electrical and electronics engineering students, this program systematically develops experimental design and analysis skills through a flipped learning model, providing a learning environment free from spatiotemporal constraints via digital devices

learning_goals: After pre-learning experimental procedure videos and materials, learners achieve 80% or higher competency in data collection and interpretation in the laboratory
Learners enhance their ability to analyze experimental errors and write reports through peer discussions and formative assessments
Learners are evaluated on self-directed experimental design and teamwork skills in a flipped learning environment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
